title: [IOTDB-1565] [To rel/0.12] Add sql: set system to readonly/writable
body:
## Description

Manually set IoTDB system to read-only or writable status.

```sql
IoTDB> SET SYSTEM TO READONLY
IoTDB> SET SYSTEM TO WRITABLE
```

Here is an example.
```sql
IoTDB> insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(100,2)
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> set system to readonly
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(200,2)
Msg: 411: Current system mode is read-only, does not support non-query operation
IoTDB> flush
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> select * from root
+-----------------------------+-------------+
|                         Time|root.sg.d1.s1|
+-----------------------------+-------------+
|1970-01-01T08:00:00.100+08:00|          2.0|
+-----------------------------+-------------+
Total line number = 1
It costs 0.273s
IoTDB> set system to writable
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(200,2)
Msg: The statement is executed successfully.
IoTDB> select * from root
+-----------------------------+-------------+
|                         Time|root.sg.d1.s1|
+-----------------------------+-------------+
|1970-01-01T08:00:00.100+08:00|          2.0|
|1970-01-01T08:00:00.200+08:00|          2.0|
+-----------------------------+-------------+
Total line number = 2
It costs 0.023s
```

title: [IOTDB-1473] Fix the bug that run SessionExample.java will be failed
[IOTDB-1519][To rel/0.12] add metadata checking option and change grammar for loading tsfile
body:
cherry pick [IOTDB-1519]add metadata checking option and change grammar for loading tsfile #3576

update:
add a option for loading tsfile sql statement.
Now the statement for loading tsfile looks like this:

load "<path/dir>" [schema=true/false] [level=int] [metadata=true/false]

for example,
we want to load tsfiles with auto creating schema, and storage group level is 1, and need metadata check, we can input sql:

load "/Users/Desktop/data/1575028885956-101-0.tsfile" schema=true,level=1,meatadata=true

if the options is missing, the default value is "schema=true,level=1,metadata=true".
for example, when we input sql:

load "/Users/Desktop/data/1575028885956-101-0.tsfile"

means:

load "/Users/Desktop/data/1575028885956-101-0.tsfile" schema=true,level=1,meatadata=true

title: [IOTDB-1568] Fix issues of blocking heartbeat broadcast and vote requesting caused
body:
See JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1568.

In my local environment, if I set heartbeatInterval to 100ms and heartbeatTimeout to 1000ms, the heartbeat broadcast and election will last more than 1000ms because of the reconnection in `getSyncClient`. After using this patch, the issue is solved.

If anyone is familar with the cluster architecture, any suggestion or discussion is welcomed.

title: [IOTDB-1586] Support mysql-style Like clause
body:
## Description

Now, the fuzzy query is more like regexy, the result is not what we want
This PR use key word regexy instead of key word like 
and realize like grammar support '%' and ' _'

select * from root.test.devcie where tmp regexy '1'
select * from root.test.devcie where tmp like '1%'
select * from root.test.devcie where tmp like '%1'
select * from root.test.devcie where tmp like '1_'
select * from root.test.devcie where tmp like '%1_'
select * from root.test.devcie where tmp like '%\\%'

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35786966/129367872-405d7efc-6fa7-48c6-b23f-3a7a177cf7f7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35786966/129365777-2791949b-9d4c-4f85-9206-368051088b5e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35786966/129365798-3341411a-e3cf-4486-86eb-e642d26ce058.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35786966/129661734-c8eb2316-4e3f-485a-80c5-e65bc25bf70f.png)

title: [To rel/0.12] Fix compaction lost ChunkGroupMetadata
body: During level compaction recover process, when using RestorableTsFileIOWriter, the metadata of last chunk group will lose, which may cause the last chunk group couldn't be found by IoTDB.

title: [To rel/0.12][IOTDB-1536]Support fuzzy query
body:
cherry pick #3649 

Since the master branch has been reconstructed from the logical query operator and 0.12 has not been reconstructed, this PR modifies some codes

title: [To rel/0.12] Fix compaction recover loses data
body:
## Description
During compaction recover, a RestorableIOWriter of target file will be new three times:
1. First new in StorageGroupProcessor, to determine whether a file is complete
2. Second new in CompactionRecoverTask, to truncate the file to the offset logged in compaction log
3. Third new in CompactionUtils, continues to compact files.

However, the last ChunkGroup in the file will be remove when a RestorableIOWriter is new. So the data will be lost when recovering inner space compaction.

In this PR, we add a new constructor for RestorableIOWriter. Beyond this, we fix a bug when truncating target file, which may cause a marker in target tsfile to be lost.

title: Fix CI runs slow caused by connection not closing
body:
## Description

The reason see #3724 .

Also be careful, **DO NOT** use this kind of pattern to create connection and statement. It will cause connection not closed.

```java
    try (Statement statement =
        DriverManager.getConnection(Config.IOTDB_URL_PREFIX + "127.0.0.1:6667/", "root", "root")
            .createStatement()) {
     ...
    }

```

also see https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/3728

title: [To rel/0.12] Fix CreateTimeseriesIT runs slow
body:
When I run this IT on my computer, it costs as long as 1 min to stop the rpc service. 
And I got an error message `org.apache.thrift.server.TThreadPoolServer:144 - Shutdown is not done after 60 SECONDS`.

The reason is this test doesn't close the statement and connection before execute `EnvironmentUtils.stopDaemon()`.

title: [To rel/0.12] Fix boostrap 1.72.0 download failed in CI because of the redirection by jfrog.io
body:
In the CI for compiling CPP in Win OS, we have to download boostrap 1.72.0.

The mechanism of https://boostorg.jfrog.io/ui/native/main/release/1.72.0/source/boost_1_72_0.zip has changed, so that we can not use `wget` command to download it anymore.

So, this PR trys to use `choco` to download it. But we have to upgrade it to 1.74.0.

If works, I will cherry-pick to master.

title: [IOTDB-1539] Fix delete operation with value filter is abnormal
body:
## Description
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1539

For now, deletion do not support values filter, but, all conditions in where clause will be treated as time condition, thus will product two affects:

1. If the data type in condition could be parsed to Long, the statement will be executed successfully, it's dangerous!!
    For example, the original statement is "delete from root.vehicle.d1.s1 where s1 > 100", but the actually statement be 
    executed is "delete from root.vehicle.d1.s1 where time > 100".  Then, data may be deleted abnormally.

2. If the data type in condition could not be parsed to Long, we will get a 500 error because of a NumberFormatException.

## Solution
Before the value filter feature is implemented, I temporally fixed this by return an error message like "For delete statement, where clause can only contain time expressions, value filter is not currently supported." if any non-time-expression appears in where clause.

title: [IOTDB-1540] Bug Fix: 500 when using IN operator
body: cherry-pick: https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/3658

title: [To rel/0.12] add JMX monitor to all ThreadPools in the server module
body:
## Description

We use many thread pools in IoTDB and it is hard to know how many thread pool we have totally and whether a thread pool is busy.

Therefore, I unify the creation of ThreadPool, register it to JMX and allow using JMX to check its active size, pending size, etc..
When the threadpool is `shutdown()` or `shutdownNow()`, the Pool will be deregistered from JMX.

Only The server module has been upgrade to such kind of ThreadPool.

I will do the same thing in the Master branch and replace all thread pools in the cluster module using this kind of thread pool.

## NOTICE

Once this PR is merged, in the server module, DO NOT USE `Executors.newXXX()` FUNCTIONS ANY MORE IN THE FUTURE.

## Screenshot

See the effect:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1021782/128897599-ef679f94-937a-4c88-b74d-219da4b268d8.png)




( This PR is hard to add UT to cover the codes. I have tested manually.)

### Abort auto create device while setStorageGroup exception
Same problem as #3707

title: [To rel/0.12][IOTDB-1556] Abort auto create device while setStorageGroup exception
body:
## Description

### Case
After operating the following operations: 
1. set storage group to root.a.sg
2. insert into root.a.d(time, s) values(1, 1)

Timeseries root.a.d.s won't be created for no storage group, but device node root.a.d will be created without storage group.

If a device node without any timeseries is created without storageGroup, then, in current code, it's unable to set any storage group on its ancestors and create any timeseries under it. Only set storage group to its descendants could be operated successfully. 

Since we don't have device node deletion oeperation, most of users will be confused and don't know how to handle this device node.

### Cause
In MManager.getDeviceNodeWithAutoCreate, if there's a storageGroupAlreadyExistException, the device node will be created with out storage group check. If the exception is caused by child node existence, then there will be no storage group above the device.

In current setStorageGroup logic, it is assumed that any timeseries or device is working under some storage group, which means a path existence implies a storage group existence.

### Solution
Modify StorageGroupAlreadyExistException with boolean hasChild added, thus mmanager could know whether the exception is caused by child.

title: [IOTDB-1541][To rel/0.12] Change sequence of wal and memtable in insert
body: When inserting data, IoTDB first inserts data into memtable and then writes wal. If writing wal occurs error, the data in memtable should rollback, but IoTDB doesn't implement this. This problem can be fixed by changing the sequence of wal and memtable in insert.

title: fix defaut max_sync_log_lag
body: The default max_sync_log_lag is mistakenly set to default max_read_log_lag.

title: [To resource_memory] add IOException throw to getDevices() method in TsFileResource
body: Since we remove the devices field in FileTimeIndex class, the getDevices() method is changed to get all deviceIds from getAllDevices() method in TsFileSequenceReader class. So the IOException is thrown from getAllDevices() method in TsFileSequenceReader class to getDevices() in FileTimeIndex, then to getDevices() in TsFileReource.

title: A new python implementation for speeding up tablet insertion
body:
## Description

### Content1: a new implementation of tablet insertion

We submit a new implementation for speeding up the **tablet insert**. The previous implementation import the built-in `struct` package to covert tablet data to byte array (see in `iotdb.utils.Tablet.Tablet#get_binary_timestamps` and `iotdb.utils.Tablet.Tablet#get_binary_values`). However, the original  implementation widely uses python `for-loop`, which is much slower than the for-loop in `Java` and `C`. 

In this pull request:

* We use `numpy` to store memory data and serialize data with `numpy.tobytes`, an efficient C-level underlying function. 
* We further use `memoryview` to concatenate multiple byte arrays. `memoryview` is a built-in buffer protocol that allows the caller to access byte arrays sequentially without intermediate copying.
* We try the `pandas` and `numpy` to narrow the gap between Java and Python during the process of data loading and Tablet construction.

Related files: 

* `IoTDB_HOME/client-py/tests/tablet_performance_comparison.py`
* `IoTDB_HOME/client-py/iotdb/utils/Tablet.py`

### Content2: a performance comparison with Java

In `IoTDB_HOME/client-py/tests/tablet_performance_comparison.py`, we conduct a fair performance comparison of Tablet-insertion between Python and Java:

* Consistent test function: Python and Java both start from loading CSV, then construct Tablet and end with  `Session.TabletInsert`. The IoTDB schema and input data are exactly the same.
* Flexible testing options: 
  * When generating CSV file, users can specify arbitrary data types: Boolean, Int32, Int64, Float, Double and TEXT.
  * The users can choose to verify the result correctness of the Tablet insertion. (add parameter `--check_result`)
  * The users can specify the amount of data: `row` and `col`.

### Content3: Experimental Result

#### How to test

1. Generate CSV data file: it's in the `tablet_performance_comparison.py` before session insert tablet. 
2. Python test: run `tablet_performance_comparison.py`
3. Java test: run `IoTDB_HOME/example/session/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/TabletExample.java` 

Note that:

* Before each test, please stop the IoTDB server, delete IoTDB data directory and restart IoTDB.
* After the test, the generated CSV data file can be deleted manually.

#### Result

Row=10000, Column=5000. The number of insert points = 10000 * 5000 * measurements.

> We ignore the negligible cost of loading data.

**Exp1**: measurements: 5 types: `Boolean`, `Int32`, `Int64`, `Float`, `Long`, no `Text` .

* Python-New Implementation is competitive with Java.
* Java is faster than Python on Tablet Construction.

| 5 data types        | Java       | Python-New | Python-Original |
| ------------------- | ---------- | ---------- | --------------- |
| Tablet Construction | 8.719      | 11.017     | 1033.407        |
| InsertTablet        | **22.932** | **20.231** | 59.215          |
| Total               | 31.7       | 31.255     | 1092.622        |

**Exp2**:  Measurements with 6 types: `Boolean`, `Int32`, `Int64`, `Float`, `Long`, `Text`.

* TEXT Insertion significantly impacts the performance of Python-New. 

| 6 data types        | Java   | Python-New | Python-Original |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- | --------------- |
| Tablet Construction | 10.533 | 12.219     | 1153.388        |
| InsertTablet        | 26.825 | 58.904     | 152.974         |
| Total               | 37.358 | 71.123     | 1306.362        |

**Exp3**: One measurement:

* Python-New spends much more time on TEXT Insertion than other types.
* When inserting only one type, Java is much faster than Python. But **Java loses its benefit when inserting multiple data types** (see in `exp1`).

| Boolean             | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.743  | 11.511     |
| InsertTablet        | 15.051 | 13.204     |
| Total               | 18.794 | 24.715     |



| Int32               | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.536  | 11.086     |
| InsertTablet        | 13.828 | 12.452     |
| Total               | 17.364 | 23.537     |



| Int64               | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.583  | 12.279     |
| InsertTablet        | 14.213 | 16.143     |
| Total               | 17.796 | 28.422     |



| Float               | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.578  | 11.461     |
| InsertTablet        | 14.59  | 14.182     |
| Total               | 18.168 | 25.643     |



| Double              | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.116  | 11.189     |
| InsertTablet        | 15.67  | 13.293     |
| Total               | 18.786 | 24.482     |



| Text                | Java   | Python-New |
| ------------------- | ------ | ---------- |
| Tablet Construction | 3.222  | 11.905     |
| InsertTablet        | 18.392 | 54.342     |
| Total               | 21.614 | 66.247     |



#### Conclusion and Future work

Compared with the original version, the new implementation has outperformed the original one, reaching or even surpassing Java. 

Unfortunately, the **tablet construction** and **data type String** are still big challenges for speeding up Tablet insertion. It's because that `Panda` or `numpy` converts String to byte arrays which are different from the original implementation, thus we have to reuse the original method directly.

We really appreciate more detailed tests and optimizations. 

<hr>

This PR has:
- [x] been self-reviewed.
- [x] added documentation for new or modified features or behaviors.
- [x] added Javadocs for most classes and all non-trivial methods. 
- [x] added comments explaining the "why" and the intent of the code wherever would not be obvious for an unfamiliar reader.
- [x] added unit tests or modified existing tests to cover new code paths, ensuring the threshold for code coverage.

<hr>

##### Key changed/added classes (or packages if there are too many classes) in this PR
* `IoTDB_HOME/client-py/iotdb/utils/Tablet.py`: add the new implementation for Tablet Insertion.
* `IoTDB_HOME/client-py/tests/tablet_performance_comparison.py`: test the performance of Python Tablet Insertion.
* `IoTDB_HOME/example/session/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/TabletExample.java`: test the performance of Java Tablet Insertion.

title: [IOTDB-1475][To rel/0.12] MeasurementId check while create timeseries or template/ disable time or timestamp in timeseries path
body:
## Description

### Problem
When users use session API to insert data and auto create time series, there's no syntax check on deviceIds or measurementIds before insert plan generating like SQL  parse. If there's a id contains symbol ".", like device id as root.sg.d and measurement id as a.b, the measurement id is obviously illegal and the meaning of path root.sg.d.a.b is ambiguous.  

Also solved https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1475 .

The schema names in template is also a loophole.

### Solution
Currently, a syntax check is added to mtree.checkTimeseries while it's going to auto create time series.
Method checkTemplateSchemaNames is  added to mmanager  while create template

### Suggestion
The illegal ids should be filtered when the API is invoked or a query is parsed as soon as possible before further operation.

title: [To rel/0.12] Stop NO_COMPACTION strategy from submitting compaction task
body:
## Description
In current no compaction strategy, the system will submit a compaction task to thread pool when system recovers, a tsfile is sealed or a timed schedule thread wakes up. The compaction task in NO_COMPACTION strategy just does nothing. But it may block the system because the submission of the task synchronized the CompactionMergeTaskManager. In this PR we stop the system from submitting compaction task when the compaction strategy is NO_COMPACTION

title: [IOTDB-1541] Change sequence of wal and memtable in insert
body: When inserting data, IoTDB first inserts data into memtable and then writes wal. If writing wal occurs error, the data in memtable should rollback, but IoTDB doesn't implement this. This problem can be fixed by changing the sequence of wal and memtable in insert.

title: [IOTDB-1526] New Template Constraint
body:
## Description

### Implement in Metadata Module
The new constraint is that one path only allow one template set on some node. It means once a template is set to a node, it will be forbidden to set any template to the node's ancestors or descendants. 
A template check method has been added to MTree and will be invoked by MManager's setSchemaTemplate method.

### Update Data-model User Guide doc
The new constraint is added to the data-model doc. The content in data-model doc is reorganized for better guidance.

### Remark
Currently, template could only be used via session and only set template is implemented. This should be implemented in concerning modules like JDBC, and further functions like unmount template should be implemented as well in future work.

title: [IOTDB-1511] Implement EntityMNode
body:
## Description

### Set IEntityMNode Interface
IEntityMNode defines the operations on an EntityMNode, in terms of aliasChilren and template usage for the time being. More functions like template lastCache will be implemented based on EntityMNode soon.

### Implement EntityMNode
The EntityMNode will be used when timeseries is created or the template is used on an InternalMNode. The parent node of a MeasurementMNode and node using template will be transform to EntityMNode.

### Implement StorageGroupEntityMNode
To avoid the conflict between StorageGroupMNode and EntityMNode, StorageGroupEntityMNode is implemented combining functions of both side, which means an entity can be a storage group and measurements can be created directly under a storage group path. StorageGroupEntityMNode extends EntityMNode and implements IStorageGroupMNode interface with the same code in StorageGroupMNode. 

### Eliminate "instanceof" usage on MNode 
Since the number of MNode class is increasing, the performance of instanceof will decrease and be no match to function override. Besides, the usage of instance violates the OO code design.

title: [IOTDB-1536]Support fuzzy query
body:
JIRA:https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-1536

support:
select * from root.sg.device where s1 like 'String'
select * from root.sg.device where s1 like 'String' and time > timestamp
select * from root.sg.device where s1 like 'String' and s2 like 'String'

title: [To rel/0.12][IOTDB-1282] fix C++ class SessionDataSet mem-leak
body:
(cherry picked from commit cea339de0fabe5a8988a80754e4efe9650bd71c8)

Issue: #2919
Master commit: #2974

title: [IOTDB-1511] Extract IStorageGroupMNode and IMeasurementMNode Interface
body:
## Description


### Extract IStorageGroupMNode Interface
Extract Interface IStorageGroupMNode and replace all StorageGroupMNode  statement with it. 

### Extract IMeasurementMNode Interface
Extract Interface IMeasurementMNode and replace all MeasurementMNode  statement with it. 

### Remark
All the changes in this PR only changes the statement or name of StorageGroupMNode and MeasurementMNode.
No logic code has been modified.

### Fix testContainer Bug
There is a nested Meausurement testcase, which should be fixed from jira_1495, in E2E testContainer. The testcase is changed.

title: [To rel/0.12] shutdown FLUSH_BUFFER_THREAD_POOL
body: The thread will increase if not shutdown the pool of each TsFile.

title: [IOTDB-1531] Check tsfile creation time when recovering
body: Check tsfile's time when recovering, make sure all tsfile time are less than System.currentTimeMillis(). If the tsfile's time is larger than System.currentTimeMillis(), the recover of corresponding virtual storage group will fail, users cannot read/write this virtual storage group until the time of the tsfile is correct. Before fixing time After fixing time
